poem:
**Stage Voyage**

From starship helm to wooden boards,  
Chris Pine navigates the velvet night.  
In London's glow, Ivanov's words  
Voyage through time, where dreams take flight.  
Kirk forgotten, beneath stage lights,  
A universe within, ignites—  
In Chekhov's depth, new worlds explored,  
Beyond the stars, a soul is moored.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Star Trek’s Chris Pine to make London theatre debut in Ivanov next summer Star Trek’s Chris Pine will boldly go to the Bridge next summer but the actor, best known for playing James T Kirk in the sci-fi reboot, is swapping the starship for the stage. For his London theatre debut, Pine has been cast in the title role of a new version of Chekhov’s early play Ivanov by Australian writer-director Simon Stone. Produced by". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
